intro: Mesembryanthemum scalpratum, commonly known as the scalped ice plant, is a succulent flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its unique adaptations to arid environments. The plant features fleshy, ribbed leaves that store water, and it produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its ability to survive in harsh conditions makes it an excellent example of desert flora.
